name: The Ghost Dance Quiz | U.S. History | 5 Questions

questions.text: What was generally the purpose of the ghost dance?
questions.explanation:
Renewal of the world.

	The ghost dance was performed during the late 19th century, during the period of encroachment on the territory of Native Americans of the great plains by the white man. The Ghost Dance was thought to be a method to renew the age prior to the white man's arrival. Also, the spirits of the dead were to be called back during the dance.

questions.text: The first Ghost Dance movment began in 1870 in the Walker Lake Reservation area of what is now which U.S. state?
Which Native American was believed to have initiated the first Ghost Dance movement?
questions.explanation:
Gray Hair.

	Gray Hair, or Wodziwob, was a Northern Paiute Indian of northern Nevada.

questions.text: The second Ghost Dance period began around 1888 and was initiated by which Native American?
questions.explanation:
Wovoka.

	Wovoka (the cutter) was a medicine man who fell into a trance during an eclipse and was told to initiate the Ghost Dance.

questions.text: A particularly intense Ghost Dance partially led to which important event in Native American history?
questions.explanation:
Wounded Knee Massacre.

	The Lakota Sioux spent several days intensively Ghost Dancing while surrounded by U.S. troops at Wounded Knee. The troops used the fact that the Natives were involved in the Ghost Dance as provocation for the one-sided melee that ensued.
